head.title: Lost a Diamond Heirloom? Frisk the Orangutan

hedline.hl1: Lost a Diamond Heirloom? Frisk the Orangutan

block.p: From Dusk Till Dawn Harvey Keitel, George Clooney, Quentin Tarantino, Juliette Lewis Directed by Robert Rodriguez R 100 minutes
From Dusk Till Dawn Harvey Keitel, George Clooney, Quentin Tarantino, Juliette Lewis Directed by Robert Rodriguez R 100 minutes

On the run from Texas authorities, the notorious Gecko brothers (Mr. Clooney and Mr. Tarantino) kidnap the lapsed preacher Jacob Fuller (Mr. Keitel) and his daughter and son (Ms. Lewis and Ernest Liu) and escape into Mexico in the family's camper. But south of the border the flight comes a cropper at a raunchy roadhouse where every last denizen, from barflys to strippers, is a vampire. Trapped inside, the Geckos and the Fullers find themselves in an all-night brawl for their lives.

VIOLENCE Virtually nonstop carnage. At one point a combatant pauses to note that vampires' bodies are soft and fall apart easily, and so they do, in great sprays of gore (more like brown glop), with limbs flying and severed heads bouncing like soccer balls. (And you ought to see the other guys.)
SEX No action but plenty of talk, lots of leering and suggestive dancing.
For Which Children? UNDER 12 Much too violent for this age group.
AGES 12 and up The rating is R, but the combination of Mr. Tarantino, vampires and riotous behavior will draw youngsters like bees to honey.
